{{book | title=The Tolkien Treasury | image = The Tolkien Treasury.jpg | author=[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] | publisher=[[HarperCollins]] | date=[[19 November]] [[2015]] | format=Hardcover, boxed set | pages= | isbn=0008116644 }} '''''The Tolkien Treasury''''' is a [[2015]] pocket boxed set published by [[HarperCollins]]. The collection includes four pocket-edition books: * ''[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]'' ** (2014 extended edition, eds. [[Christina Scull]] & [[Wayne G. Hammond]]) * ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]'' ** (2014 edition, eds. Christina Scull & Wayne G. Hammond) * ''[[Roverandom]]'' ** (2013 edition, eds. Christina Scull & Wayne G. Hammond) * ''[[Smith of Wootton Major]]'' ** (2015 extended edition, ed. [[Verlyn Flieger]]) ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|De luxe boxed gift set of Tolkien’s most popular and charming tales; full of wit and humour, giants, dragons, magic and more, they are collected together for the first time and will delight readers of all ages.
Farmer Giles did not look like a hero. He was fat and red-bearded and enjoyed a slow, comfortable life. Then one day a rather deaf and short-sighted giant blundered on to his land…
The Adventures of Tom Bombadil collects hobbit-verses from the ‘Red Book’ and other poems relating legends and jests of the Shire at the end of the Third Age.
Smith of Wootton Major tells of the preparation of the Great Cake to mark the Feast of Good Children and the magical events which follow.
Roverandom is a real dog who is magically transformed into a toy and is forced to seek out the wizard who wronged him in order to be returned to normal. The story was written to console Tolkien's four-year-old son, Michael, who lost a beloved toy dog on the beach.}} ==See also== * [[The Middle-earth Treasury]] boxed set {{title|italics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tolkien Treasury, The}} [[Category:Fiction books]] [[Category:Books by J.R.R.
